dublin_core.dcvalue: This article analyzes telemedicine the use of distant communication technologies within the context of clinical health care and the effects it has on health communication The main effect is that telemedicine has the capacity to substantially transform health care in both positive and negative ways and to radically modify personal face to face communication Turner 2003 This has tremendous implications for health communication scholars in that they can extend the telemedicine debate by integrating fresh insights into more acceptable approaches that will refine and humanize mediated channels of health communication There are several key areas of telemedicine that need to be discussed i e e health services clinical encounters etc all of which are identified in this article In addition to describing the past and current applications of telemedicine this article provides a better understanding of unique needs resources problems and opportunities germane to telemedicine services
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-10T17:22:47Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2007-04-27
Telemedicine: its effects on health communication.
